Package uk.ac.liv.auction.core

The core classes used by JASA

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Auction  
AuctionClosingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing an auction.
Auctioneer  
DayEndingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of ending an auction day.
ParameterizablePricing Auctioneer classes implementing this interface indicate that they support parameterisable pricing rules, as per the k-double-auction variants.
PricingPolicy Classes implementing this interface define pricing policies for auctioneers.
QuoteProvider  
ShoutEngine  
 

Class Summary
AbstractAuctioneer An abstract class representing an auctioneer managing shouts in an auction.
Account  
AlwaysAcceptingPolicy the losest accepting policy under which all shouts are allowed.
AscendingAuctioneer Auctioneer for standard multi-unit english ascending auction.
AscendingShoutComparator This class can be used to as a Comparator to rank shouts in ascending order.
AuctionImpl An abstract implementation of Auction that provides basic logging facilities.
ClearingHouseAuctioneer An auctioneer for a clearing house auction.
CombiTimingCondition The class for expressing the combination of timing conditions.
ContinuousDoubleAuctioneer An auctioneer for a double-auction with continuous clearing.
ContinuousDoubleAuctioneerEE Deprecated. GenericDoubleAuctioneer with EquilibriumBeatingAcceptingPolicy should be used.
ContinuousDoubleAuctioneerNoQueue An auctioneer for a k-double-auction with continuous clearing and no order queuing.
DescendingShoutComparator A comparator that can be used for arranging shouts in descending order; that is, highest price first.
DiscriminatoryPricingPolicy A pricing policy in which we set the transaction price in the interval between the matched prices as determined by the parameter k.
EquilibriumBeatingAcceptingPolicy implements the shout-accepting rule under which a shout must be more competitive than an estimated equilibrium.
FourHeapShoutEngine This class provides auction shout management services using the 4-Heap algorithm.
GenericDoubleAuctioneer An modular auctioneer for a double auction.
InOrderPricingPolicy  
KPricingPolicy Abstract superclass for auctioneer pricing policies parameterised by k.
MarketClearingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of clearing the current market.
MarketQuote A price quote summarising the current state of an auction.
MaxDaysAuctionClosingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing an auction.
MaxRoundsAuctionClosingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing an auction.
MaxRoundsDayEndingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing an auction.
McAfeeClearingHouseAuctioneer An implementation of the mechanism described in "A Dominant Strategy Double Auction" R.
NPricingPolicy A discriminatory pricing policy that uses the average of the last n pair of bid and ask prices leading to transactions as the clearing price.
NullAuctionClosingCondition  
NullPricingPolicy  
PeriodicClearingHouseAuctioneer Deprecated.  
ProbabilisticClearingCondition The class for expressing whether the market should be cleared or not.
QuiescentDayEndingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing an auction.
QuoteBeatingAcceptingPolicy implements the NYSE rule under which a shout must improve the market quote to be acceptable.
RandomClearingDoubleAuctioneer Deprecated.  
RandomRobinAuction A class representing an auction in which RoundRobinTraders can trade by placing shouts in a synchronous round-robin shedule.
RoundClearingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of clearing the current market.
RoundRobinAuction Deprecated.  
SealedShoutAuctioneer  
Shout A class representing a shout in an auction.
Shout.MutableShout A Shout that is publically mutable.
ShoutAcceptingPolicy Classes implementing this interface define policies for accepting shouts.
ShoutStepAuction  
ShoutTypeBasedAcceptingPolicy implements the shout-accepting rule under which a shout must be more competitive than an estimated equilibrium.
TimingCondition The interface for expressing the condition of closing a certain time interval, such as an auction, or a day, or whether it's time to do something, i.e.
TransparentAuctioneer  
UniformPricingPolicy A pricing policy in which we set the transaction price in the interval between the ask quote and the bid quote as determined by the parameter k.
ZeroCreditAccount  
ZeroFundsAccount  
 

Exception Summary
AuctionClosedException  
AuctionException  
AuctionRuntimeException  
DataUnavailableException This is exception is thrown when requesting data from an auction that is not available due to the way that the auction is configured.
DuplicateShoutException  
IllegalShoutException This exception is thrown by auctioneers when a shout placed in an auction is illegal under the rules of the auction.
NotAnImprovementOverQuoteException This exception is thrown by an auctioneer implementing the NYSE rule if a trader agent attempts to place a shout that is not an improvement over the current best bid.
ShoutsNotVisibleException This exception is thrown if an agent attempts to examine the shouts of other agents in an auction where the auctioneer does not permit agents to see each others shouts.
 

Package uk.ac.liv.auction.core Description

The core classes used by JASA
